titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yehudit Shadur Mizrach Papercut, 1975 RL.11562
titlestmt.author: Alice Poffinberger

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-12-06 14:19:28 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Yehudit Shadur (1928-2011) pioneered the contemporary revival of the Jewish papercutting tradition. Collection comprises a papercut by Yehudit Shadur, entitled "Mizrach" (east wall marker), from the original in the Jewish National Museum and Archives, Israel. Cut blue paper; mounted on brown paper. 15.25 x 18.75 inches.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Yehudit Shadur (1928-2011) grew up in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, and studied fine art and art history in Milwaukee, London, and New York. In 1950, she settled in Israel, first on kibbutz Nirim in the Negev and later in Jerusalem. For several years she lived and taught at the Sdeh Boqer College of the Negev. Besides her work based on traditional Jewish folk art, she exhibited landscape drawings and has worked in various print-making techniques, mural compositions, and Jewish decorative arts. Yehudit Shadur pioneered the contemporary revival of the Jewish papercutting tradition.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Yehudit Shadur Mizrach Papercut was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yehudit Shadur Mizrach Papercut, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2017-0112
